item.description:
Does Thoreau Have a Future:

Reimagining Voluntary Simplicity for the Twenty-first Century

Important Note: CSWR events are free and open to the public, but seating is limited and reservations are required. Register HERE.

Thursday, March 25, 2010, 5:15 pm

Location: Sperry Room, Andover Hall, 45 Francis Avenue

A presentation by Lawrence Buell, Powell M. Cabot Professor of American Literature, in Harvard's Department of English and American Literature and Language. A response will be given by Diana Eck, Professor of Comparative Religion and Indian Studies in Harvard's Faculty of Arts and Sciences and Member of the Faculty of Divinity.
item.how_to_find_us: No organizer will be present. See message board below.
item.name: Voluntary Simplicity @ CSWR
